content: Design a SQL query that retrieves data from a "Students" table and sorts the result by grade in descending order. Assume the "Students" table has fields for "Name", "Grade", and "Age". PLAINFORMAT

Certainly! To design a SQL query that retrieves data from a "Students" table and sorts the result by grade in descending order, you can use the SELECT statement along with the ORDER BY clause. Here's how you can structure the query:

```sql
SELECT Name, Grade, Age
FROM Students
ORDER BY Grade DESC;
```

This query selects all records from the "Students" table and orders them based on the "Grade" field in descending order. This means that students with higher grades will appear first in the result set.
